topic.title: TCP TBT5 Retimer with Internal Cable Topology

fig.title: TCP TBT5 Retimer with Internal Cable Topology

image.href: FIG_tcp tbt5 retimer with internal cable topology_1.png

table.title: TCP TBT5 Retimer with Internal Cable Topology Notes

entry.p: Microstrip main route routing must be interleaved.
To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS.

If MS main route routing is needed, 800µm spacing to equivalent signal (S-ES) is required between differential pairs. In cases where spacing to equivalent signal (S-ES) must be decreased due to breakout and break-in region routing constraints, ensure to gradually widen the spacing from 375um back to the standard 800µm to preserve signal integrity. Minimize length of section of routing that has less than 800um spacing.
Refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.
Full ground reference is required. Dual reference/ Power reference not allowed.
Reference plane for dual stripline route
Full ground reference is required. Dual reference/ Power reference not allowed.
Please refer to Thunderbolt Retimer documentation for more details. Refer to RDC #843990 for June Bridge 80 Retimer guidelines.
When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented:
When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented:
When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented:
i. If EPR is @ 28 V, then Rc should be 2.7 Ω ± 5%.
ii. If EPR is @ 36 V, then Rc should be 3.24 Ω ± 5%.
iii. If EPR is @ 48 V, then Rc should be 4.02 Ω ± 5%.
Recommend having a placeholder for an 0201 Rb resistor between the AC cap and Type-C connector on the SSTX pairs.
ESD Diode, AC cap, Rb Resistor and Rc Resistor should be placed as close as possible to USBC connector up to 8mm radius.
Total insertion loss budget from retimer pins to Type-C connector pads
Ball to RCP pad (w/o connector). Inclusive of HVM variation. Not inclusive of connector.
Thunderbolt 5.0, Thunderbolt 4.0, USB4.0 Gen3, USB3.2 Gen2x2 and DP2.1 (UHBR20).
Must adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).

section.title: Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Rx,Tx, Post-Channel

table.title: TCP TBT5 Retimer with Internal Cable Topology Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Rx,Tx, Post-Channel Routing Guidelines

section.title: Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Rx,Tx, Pre-Channel

table.title: TCP TBT5 Retimer with Internal Cable Topology Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Rx,Tx, Pre-Channel Routing Guidelines

entry.p: Minimize BO length to less than 2mm in the escape area near ball for Microstrip lines on Top or Bottom layer. Don't need to consider BO in the inner layer.
DSL may cause via stub to be longer than the maximum required 250um. Via stub mitigation routing technique may be employed.
This cable length assumes a FFC cable with the insertion loss of 5.6dB at Nyquist frequency

section.p: Max Length Total Note: BO+M1+M2+M3<= 135mm. If 90% of the routings are implemented in stripline traces, M1+M2 length can be extended to 135mm & BO+M1+M2+M3<=155mm. Max length not including cable.
